column5: I was talking with a friend at work today and he was telling me about someone he knows that recently went to Canada for a trade show of some sort and had to obtain a Visa in order to get into the country.I hope this doesn't mean we will need the same for our annual fishing trip.You never know these days with war looming and terrorism a constant possibility. Has anyone else heard anything about this?

There is an article in this morning's (1/31)Rochester,NY paper that says a passport may be required to re-enter the U.S. from trips (even day trips) to Canada and Mexico. A hassle, yes, but a small price to pay for security.

I'm a truck driver and have crossed at Port Huron/Sarnia 6 times this month. All that is required is your drivers license. It's good to have a copy of your birth certificate but I've never needed to show it. Sometimes I've had lots of questions asked when I return to the U.S. but that's to be expected in these times. Just remember that these customs/immigration people are doing their jobs. Occasionaly you'll encounter one of them who's having a bad day but I've learned to just brush it off. The good people I've done business with in Canada far outweigh any bad experiences at the border.Have fun on your trip.
